result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Heath Kelly Hadler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation expires before any recommendations can be completed, those recommendations are to be transferred to the one year DPA requirements. The Agent is to contact the District Attorney's office at the end of the 6 month probation period with the necessary information.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heath Kelly Hadler

4:51 Defendant Heath Kelly Hadler in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: guilty Ct#1 will have a DPA and Ct#2 with 1 year probation. Thorie files an amended information.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to amended Ct#1 and Ct#2; Helgeson stipulates to a factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds Def guilty of amended Ct#1.  Court withholds judgment of conviction on amended Ct#1. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of amended Ct#2. Thorie gives sentencing argument for probation on Ct#2. Helgeson joins in the recommendation for the DPA and requesting time served and no probation. Court: S/W 6 months probation on Ct#2. conditions: court costs. if probation expires before any recommendations are completed in this 6 months, those recommendations are to be transferred to the one year DPA requirements. The Agent is to contact the DA's office at the end of the 6 months if any uncompleted recommendations need to be added to the DPA. Attorney's fees need to be paid in 1 year. DPA is approved and Court signs.

Criminal Jury Trial Scheduling Order

Final pre-trial at 01-19-2016 02:45 pm.
Jury trial at 02-11-2016 08:30 am.
Victim's Petition for Bond Modification.
Court lifts no contact order.  No abusive contact.

4:05  Defendant Heath Kelly Hadler in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson who appears by telephone.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim requests the bond condtions be amended to no abusive contact.  Court lifts the no contact and will now have the bond to state no abusive contact.
State's
Pre-trial conference at 10-27-2015 11:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing at 10-14-2015 04:00 pm.

8:46 Defendant Heath Kelly Hadler in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim requested a bond modification to drop no contact with the DA's office. Atty Helgeson addresses and requests no contact be lifted. Froelich opposes lifting the no contact and addresses.  Court: would like to address the victim about the no contact even though it's her request. Bond will continue as is until a hearing is held with victim and Def.
Def pleas not guilty to both counts. Court enters not guilty plea. Def to remain until he is handed a notice of hearing.

8:42 Defendant Heath Kelly Hadler in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rightsCourt finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds the Defendant probably commited a felony and binds the def over.   Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.   Court reads charges and possible penalties. Def waives further reading.

Bail/bond hearing at 10-12-2015 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 10-12-2015 08:30 am.

4:04 Defendant Heath Kelly Hadler in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears in court.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Froelich: $3000 sign bond with no contacts. Nelson no objection to signature bond; questions no contact provisions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
